text: next you will hear from this year's
student speaker Andrew stern light a
proud member of section I but before he
gives his speech I think it's important
to give background on how he was
selected and a little more information
on Andrew the class day student speaker
was selected by a panel of judges
representing each section each
contestant that we heard provided
presentations that were funny moving and
superbly encapsulated the many takeaways
of our transformative HBS experience we
felt privileged to hear from such a
talented group in wish we could share
all the speeches with you it was a very
tough decision but in the end we were
only able to pick one presenter now to
give you a little background on Andrew
he was born in California some 28 years
ago to a lovely family who is here with
him today Andrew attended harvard
college and graduated with a degree in
social studies after college Andrew
co-founded the non profit venture higher
edge which helps low-income public high
school students are an admission to and
prepare for some of America's most
selective universities via an intensive
and integrated mentorship model he also
concurrently worked in the motion
picture motion picture business affairs
at Paramount Pictures he returned to the
classroom both at the Harvard Business
School and at yale law school after
graduation he intends to pursue a
lifelong career of entrepreneurship and
work on his own start up again in both
the public and social sectors however
there's a lot more to Andrew than just
the bullet points of his resume before
today I decided to do a little digging I
asked some of his closest friends their
thoughts and Andrew the primary question
I asked each of them was to describe
Andrew in just three words as responses
came in it was incredible to see that
each person asks use generally the same
three words caring thoughtful
dedicated they elaborated on these
virtues through three telling examples
first as mentioned immediately after his
undergraduate studies Andrew was the
founder and CEO of his own startup
obviously this was a very impressive
accomplishment that shows much of
Andrews drive and talent however this
venture wouldn't have been truly Andrew
without having the broader purpose of
helping others through providing better
access to quality education the second
example as if Andrews plate wasn't full
enough being dual enrolled in both law
and business school he also served as a
tutor for one of harvard's undergraduate
houses this position is truly a
full-time job and it has amazed those
close to Andrew of his ability to juggle
juggle his studies while and I'm quoting
here having to deal with the day-to-day
issues of those often unruly Harvard
undergraduates what is equally amazing
is the deep respect Andrews students
displayed towards him this respect has
earned was earned through never-ending
patience thoughtful guidance and true
concern for all those he mentors finally
Andrews care and concern for others
extends beyond those under his watch and
includes all of his friends and family
even with the busy schedule he is always
willing to set aside time to talk listen
and provide thoughtful advice to any of
his friends people truly enjoy his
company and look to him as a genuine
friend and mentor one response
summarized it best everyone I know who
knows Andrew stern light is in love with
Andrew stern light ladies and gentlemen
I give you your 2012 class day speaker
Andrew stern light
Thank You Luke in the great tradition of
a Harvard Business School you've set
expectations I cannot live up to Dean
nuria ms Sandberg distinguished faculty
and staff members of the class of 2012
section I and ladies and gentlemen it is
a great honor to stand here before you
and especially today and 2012 at such a
turbulent yet auspicious time in our
planets history 2012 marks new chapters
in the Greek debt crisis where the fate
of a sovereign nation relies on the
companionship of its greater community
it marks the landing of nasa's mars
curiosity rover literally expanding our
worlds frontiers and it marks the
implacable admonitions of the Mayan
apocalypse that our world once and for
all will explode in a thunderstorm of
fire and brimstone if these warnings are
accurate than the fact that they've let
me speak to you today must certainly be
one of the four horsemen now at the end
of our two-year journey it seems
appropriate to muse about what goals
brought us all here in the first place
perhaps we came to HBS to feed upon
prestige as the philosophy professor
william james once characterized
graduate school at Harvard we dangled
our three magic letters before the eyes
of these predestined victims and they
swarm to us like moths to an electric
light or perhaps it was de fever ishly
network engaging in something the writer
Ambrose Bierce once likened to social
promiscuity even my iphone has begun to
miss the seductive love trip of your
calendar invites but I think it was
search for something much greater that
through purposefully disrupting our
lives we would have the chance to
discover and embrace a new perspective
about what is important to us
and how we should live today in that
regard I'd like to share with you a very
personal story that left me with to
lasting lessons I think we must always
remember lessons that I call the
unforgettables during my senior year at
college I was diagnosed with an
aggressive metastatic form of cancer
thinking that I pushed myself too hard
at the gym I for a long time ignored a
nagging pain in my lower back that
distracted me from more important
responsibilities like recruiting for
jobs and planning life after graduation
I remember the moment when I had to
explain to my parents there was a chance
I was going to die but after three
months of chemotherapy I was in the
clear though chemo did provide a free
weight loss program and full body wax I
never approached the standards of
fitness and glamorous set by my HBS
classmates Olympic athletes Navy SEALs
and the rest of you who accidentally got
fit while stalking Tyra Banks at shack
and place the physical strength I
developed fresh eyes in what I consider
to be my second lease on life now i'm
not here to frighten you into paying a
visit to your doctor or to persuade you
to swear off the con instead i want to
share with you two thoughts that ever
since chemo i keep struggling to
remember but must never forget one is
about community and the other is about
purpose first about community i learned
something unforgettable from staring
death in the eyes and hoping i would not
blink first thinking that i only had a
few months to live i faced a basic but
difficult challenge to somehow muster
the will to fight every day or two
compliantly accept my fate whatever it
might be with plenty of time to marinate
in my memories i discovered that what
mattered to me most were not scholastic
or professional achievements but instead
the moment i had spent with my family
and my friends the same people who were
taking care of me in the hospital
and who flew from California to be here
today this community of people gave me
an elixir that even my best doctors
couldn't provide a sense of hope that
encouraged me to fight hard when others
gave up when I'm older and weaker I know
I'll once again measure my life in terms
of these loving relationships I ask you
to remind me and each other to never
forget to give freely of yourselves to
your family and to your community even
Adam Smith that forefather of capitalism
first articulated his idea for the
invisible hand not in the economically
principle wealth of nations but rather
in his earlier study of human
relationships Theory of Moral Sentiments
there Smith clarified that gains from
trade represent much more than just
surpluses from the exchange of goods
rather they also include the
compassionate self-giving pledged by
people who realize their human potential
through sympathy and through fellowship
with associates friends and family at
HBS we have been part of something much
greater than ourselves and I am not
talking just about the symbolic
trappings of tradition yes we all do
where the identical black fleece not so
much to advertise our sophisticated
pedigree but rather so that on cold late
nights in Boston strangers know where to
send us home no instead I mean that
despite celebrating the rich differences
that have fascinated and informed our
studies these last two years what
matters much more is our common humanity
I have no doubt that in the days that
follow each of us will face sleepless
sickly nights at some point will be
haunted by regrets and will marinate in
past memories searching for meaning and
that as we begin to submit to a
seemingly predestined feet our hope will
falter even today we may feel that Hope
has betrayed us
but through the loving companionship
that we share we can inspire each other
to hope once again as we take our next
steps we must remind remember to ask
ourselves what authentic friendships did
we build in this place did we find love
and if not have we created our profile
yet on IV date community is the first
unforgettable now about the second
unforgettable purpose during treatment I
regretted most deeply that I had been so
concerned with others definitions of
success that I hadn't done the things in
life that I had wanted to do I lost my
childhood ability to dream big and take
risks in other words I hadn't lived with
purpose now it sure would be convenient
for me to say that the meaning of life
magically appears in the walls of the
cancer ward and that I am here today to
share that prophecy with you for that
you must instead wait for the Mayan
apocalypse quite the contrary in the end
and a Lester chemo meds are getting to
you there is no voice that proclaims
your role in this universe but as Martin
Luther King reminded me darkness cannot
drive out darkness only light can do
that I promised myself one thing if I
were given one more chance to live I
would stop living in fear instead start
embracing a deeper faith in myself that
I too can do something truly remarkable
after all the tragedy of my life was not
that it might end so soon but that I
waited so long to begin living it when I
finally recovered from treatment my
attention quickly shifted from
fulfilling the expectations of others to
trying to rediscover my own purpose but
while I've enjoyed some wild adventures
in the process I am still searching of
course there's definitely enough purpose
to go around the world's greatest
misfortunes don't rest quietly in our
past but rather stand before us today
illness climate change powerlessness in
the face of Korra
these evils that rarely cast shadows on
the red bricks of HBS or the white walls
of global capitalism are more alive
today than ever before these are dark
times that require purposeful agents and
yet despite that darkness there is today
an unimaginable opportunity for
innovation and leadership to build a
more free sustainable and healthy global
society as graduates of the Harvard
Business School we have been offered the
chance to make this difference we have
been given skills perspectives and
relationships to put in motion the great
revolutions the world hasn't yet seen in
his inaugural address of 1933 President
Franklin Delano Roosevelt took note of
hard times not unlike those we face
today he shared about emaciated GDPs
vanished personal savings withering
industrial enterprise and pervasive
unemployment but Roosevelt's reply
merits Restatement today happiness he
reflected lies not in the mad chase of
evanescent profits but instead and the
joy of achievement the thrill of
creative effort all towards a greater
purpose on the eve of launching his new
deal Roosevelt reminded himself of the
purposeful life upon which he had
embarked and that the darkness of his
times could only be driven out by a
bright belief in something much bigger
than himself we cannot forget to ask
each other about our life's purpose are
we dreaming big enough are we daring to
hazard the challenges that have
perplexed previous generations are we
chasing that purpose with everything
we've got so class of 2012 as we take
our next step into the great unknown
before us I ask you to remind me and to
remind each other of two unforgettable
ideas first with your extraordinary
talents give freely of yourself to your
community and embrace your capacity to
love companionship can salvage the
Europe
currency and it might just save your
life second figure out your purpose and
pursue it with everything you have like
the Mars Curiosity rover take exciting
chances to cross new frontiers because
in the end life is so short in the
language of Facebook you get to create
your own profile and direct your own
timeline purpose is unforgettable
community is unforgettable a new class
of 2012 are unforgettable to me thank
